content:
Diagnosis:

Metastatic colorectal adenocarcinoma (hepatic flexure primary)
Diagnosed March 2024
Duke's D, BRAF V600K mutant, MMR proficient
Liver and bone metastases

Treatment History:
Cycle 1-2 FOLFIRI/Bevacizumab March-April 2024
Cycle 3 complicated by neutropenic sepsis requiring ITU admission
Progression on CT after cycle 4 May 2024

Current Situation:
Significant clinical deterioration over past 2 weeks
Requiring opiate escalation for bone pain
New onset confusion and lethargy

Clinical Assessment:
Performance status declined to ECOG 3
Jaundiced with tender hepatomegaly
Confused and drowsy but rousable

Investigation Results:
CT 15/05/24: Multiple new liver lesions, largest 8.2cm
Progressive bone metastases with pathological T8 fracture
Bilirubin 85, ALT 156, ALP 455

Discussion with patient and family:
Explained disease progression and poor prognosis
Agreed to cease active treatment
Referral made to palliative care team

Plan:
Urgent admission arranged to hospice
Palliative care team to take over management
GP updated by telephone regarding situation

Significant deterioration with decline in performance status to ECOG 3
Decision to cease active treatment and transition to palliative care
Urgent admission arranged to hospice with palliative care team takeover
